item.title: Large plastic advertising banners dumped behind Co-op car park billboards, 21st January
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to report a large amount of dumped plastic advertising material located behind the advertising billboards in the Co-op car park area near the A2 in Blackfen. On Sunday, a group of GoodGym volunteers carried out a litter-picking session in this location and removed 15 bags of general rubbish from the area. However, several large pieces of plastic banner from advertising billboards were left behind, as they are extremely heavy and unsafe for volunteers to handle or transport. These discarded banners appear to have been left for some time and are clearly visible behind the billboards. Unfortunately, their presence seems to encourage further fly-tipping, and the area is becoming a hotspot for dumped waste. We would be grateful if the council could arrange for these items to be safely removed to prevent further environmental damage and discourage additional fly-tipping in the area. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Kind regards, Marianna Chernobrivenko GoodGym Bexley

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Lane, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass and debris all around junction Avenue Road/ Crook Log/Broadway, 21st January
item.description:
There was a car accident on Monday and all the debris from the crash has been scattered all over the road on the junction of Crook Log/ Avenue Road and Broadway. There is also some debris that has been placed on top of a hedge opposite Asda. Please can this be cleared as a matter of urgency as one of the residents has already trip over some of it. It's on the roads and pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13-15, Crook Log, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
